identificationModule.briefTitle: MTPr With Shockwave on Pain & Function of SHS in Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Myofascial Trigger Points Release With Shockwave Therapy on Pain and Function of Shoulder Hand Syndrome in Stroke Patients With Diabetic Neuropathy

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Lecturer of physical therapy, Department of Neuromuscular disorders and its surgery, faculty of physical therapy, october 6 univerisity

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Background: shoulder-hand syndrome is considered a significant reason for the reduction of upper limb functions after stroke. Purpose: To investigate the influence of Myofascial Trigger Points (MTrPs) release and shockwave therapy on pain and functions of the upper extremity in stroke patients with diabetic neuropathy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Methods: two equal groups of thirty stroke patients, divided into, study group: which treated with MTrPs release combined with shockwave therapy and conventional program, while control group: treated with a conventional selected exercise program.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: study group: which treated with MTrPs release combined with shockwave therapy and conventional program, while control group: treated with a conventional selected exercise program

armGroups.label: study group
armGroups.description: which treated with MTrPs release combined with shockwave therapy and conventional program
interventionNames: Other: Myofascial trigger points pressure (MTrP) release

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: which treated with conventional physical therapy program

interventions.name: Myofascial trigger points pressure (MTrP) release
interventions.description: Myofascial trigger points pressure (MTrP) release technique, the initial step was to recognize and find the trigger points (TP) , and The second step after TP palpation was the MTrP release technique, as follow, by one or both hands, the thumbs or four fingers of the therapist applied a maintained pressure, pushing internal toward the middle

interventions.name: Shockwave therapy application
interventions.description: The JEST-2000 (JOEUN Medical, Dae-Jeon, South Korea) was used for the ESWT. The application of pressure pulses of ESWT was centered around the flexor muscles with hypertonia

interventions.name: conventional therapy
interventions.description: Passive ROM exercises performed by the therapist and Bobath Neurodevelopmental Approach (prolonged stretch): The Intervention methods for Bobath involved the activation of key points of control for the reduction of tone

primaryOutcomes.measure: - Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS) severity score
primaryOutcomes.description: It is a quantitative index and valid instrument to score and monitor the severity of CRPS and SHS.

primaryOutcomes.measure: - Figure-of-Eight Method of Measuring Hand Size for hand swelling
primaryOutcomes.description: The figure-of-eight technique utilizing tape measurement for hand size

primaryOutcomes.measure: - Visual analogue scale for pain (VAS-P) for pain assessment
primaryOutcomes.description: The VAS for pain is a valid and reliable assessment of pain intensity, as a straight horizontal line of fixed length (10 cm) considered the simplest VAS.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* stroke from 4:8 months
* age ranging from 45:60 years
* All the patients were identified with SHS as diagnosed by the Diagnostic criteria for SHS post-stroke 18 and were in stage I of syndrome evolution

Exclusion Criteria:

* any other causes of shoulder pain in the hemiplegic side of the body
* a cognitive impairment
* structured joint deformity in the painful shoulder or hand
* other musculoskeletal disorders of UE.
